channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for CA

item.title: Report X-2024030617
item.description:
Report X-2024030617

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: FRA inspector found UTLX 680015 to be dripping from the BOV. Upon inspection by mechanical, the BOV cap was less than tool-tight. The valve was closed and the BOV cap was tool-tightened, stopping the drip. Kitty litter was applied to the tie and brushed in.

item.title: Report X-2024030822
item.description:
Report X-2024030822

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-26T15:10:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-06
  • City: CITY OF INDUSTRY
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: ITEM WAS BEING unload from trailer when damaged was discovered. DescribePack: a loose cap allowed the liquid to spilled inside the box, concentrating on the bottom of the area. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: item was secured in a hazmat bag and removed from the area; top part of bag was left open to allowed ventilation.

item.title: Report X-2024030846
item.description:
Report X-2024030846

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-26T15:10:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-13
  • City: CARSON
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found by QA during the preload sort and declared damaged. Put inside hazmat liner and red tote to stop spilling. MSDS report obtained by shipper. SCMS was processed. Then taken to the hazmat processing cage and put inside a yellow bin. Total duration 1 hour. DescribePack: Contents shattered and found leaking DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was immediately put in a lined red tote and processed by qualified personnel.

item.title: Report X-2024030844
item.description:
Report X-2024030844

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-26T15:10:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-13
  • City: ANAHEIM
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was discovered to be wet on the outer container when being unloaded. Package was placed in a hazmat bag and tote. Upon inspection of the content we found one of the four bottles had a missing cap causing it to leak out all of the content. all clean up material was kept with package. DescribePack: One of the four bottles had a missing cap causing it to leak out. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was place in a hazmat bag and tote.

DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: SPILL NEUTRALIZED AND COLLECTED WITH PH9 AND DUSTPAN. PACKAGE PLACED IN HAZMAT BAG LINED TOTE.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found by QA during the preload sort and declared damaged. Put inside hazmat liner and red tote to stop spilling.MSDS report obtained by shipper. SCMS was processed. Then taken to the hazmat processing cage and put inside a yellow bin. Total duration 1 hour. DescribePack: The bottles had loose caps and spilled DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was immediately put inside a red lined tote and processed by qualified QA personnel.

item.title: Report X-2024030942
item.description:
Report X-2024030942

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-25T15:12:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-15
  • City: FRESNO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2024030942 SequenceEvent: QA was called to head towards load side 3 and upon arrival QA was notified that the package was leaking. Once QA was notified of damaged hazmat they then quarantined the area ran to get the apropriate gear and items to bag the package. Once they bagged all the packages they then nutralized the spilled content and cleaned the area. DescribePack: Upon inspection the bottom was wet and when we opened the package we inspected all bottles inside and noticed that there was a crack at the bottom. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: quarantined the area and placed spill mats and then spreaded out nutrilizing agent. 2. X-2024030943 SequenceEvent: QA was called to head towards load side 3 and upon arrival QA was notified that the package was leaking. Once QA was notified of damaged hazmat they then quarantined the area ran to get the apropriate gear and items to bag the package. Once they bagged all the packages they then nutralized the spilled content and cleaned the area. DescribePack: Upon inspection the bottom was wet and when we opened the package we inspected all bottles inside and noticed that there was a crack at the bottom. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: quarantined the area and placed spill mats and then spreaded out nutrilizing agent.

item.title: Report X-2024030737
item.description:
Report X-2024030737

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-25T15:12:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-08
  • City: OCEANSIDE
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Shipment external packaging was discolored and emitted a sharp chemical odor and was removed from the sort stream and put into a plastic lined container . DescribePack: Both of the plastic bottles were dented on their sides, one of them had a finger loose cap which was the source of the spillage. DurationRel: 11 and MitigateEffect: Excess liquid was soaked up using neutral absorbent material. The rest of the shipment was placed inside a plastic lined container for inspection and processing.

item.title: Report X-2024030987
item.description:
Report X-2024030987

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-25T15:12:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-12
  • City: ALISO VIEJO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDED TO A PACKAGE THAT WAS COLD TO THE TOUCH. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED APPROXIMATELY FIVE POUNDS OF DRY ICE COOLING FOOD. FRAGILE AND THIS SIDE UP STICKERS HAVE BEEN APPLIED TO THE OUTER BOX. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX TO INDICATE DRY ICE WAS BEING SHIPPED IN THE AIR NETWORK.

item.description:

  • Description: SequenceEvent: The exterior packaging was discolored on the top and side, especially around where the water activated tape secured the box closures. The shipment was placed into a plastic lined container and removed from the sort stream for inspection. DescribePack: The caps were loose on two of the four bottles inside. The bottles were also dented on their side surfaces . DurationRel: 5 and MitigateEffect: Excess liquid was soaked up using neutral absorbent material. The rest of the shipment was secured inside a plastic lined container.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE CAME FROM THE UNLOAD WET. PACKAGE DAMAGED IN TRANSIT. CAPS ON BOTTLES LESS THAN FINGER TIGHT. DescribePack: TWO BOTTLES LEAKED FROM LOOSE CAPS. ONE BOTTLE WITH CAP A FULL TURN LOOSE. 6/10THS OF A GALLON LOSS. ALL GOODS SOILED. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: SPILL NEUTRALIZED AND COLLECTED WITH PH9 AND DUSTPAN. PACKAGE PLACED IN HAZMAT BAG LINED DRUM.

DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed inside a plastic tote by management to contain the leakage.

item.description:

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 3/12/2024 at approximately 1200, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 5805558 at the station location in San Jose, reporting a paint spill. The shipment consisted of 4 fiberboard boxes, each containing 10 metal cans. One of the cans in one of the packages appeared to accidentally discharged, resulting in spillage. The unharried packages have been delivered and the affected package is being held for an amended shipper's declaration for further transport.

DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Drum was carefully placed in a red tote along with the absorbing pads used to clean the affected area.
